src: ɯ-ɣɯ-jɤ-kɯ-qru tɤ-tɕɯ
trs: The boy who had come to look for her.' (The three sisters, 231)

src: tɤ-mtʰɯm ʁɟa ʑo ma nɯ ma, nɤki, tɯjpu mɤ-kɯ-ndza ci tu tɕe,
trs: There is (an animal like the mouse) which only eats meat, not food made from flour.' (27-spjaNkW, 202-2063)

src: li nɯnɯ kɯnɤ ɯ-kɯ-mto ɣɤʑu, ɯ-mɤ-kɯ-mto ɣɤʑu.
trs: There are (people) who see (find) it, and people who don't.' (20-sWrna, 20)

src: a-kɯ-tʰu
trs: The one asking for me (in marriage).' (elicited)

src: nɯ ma nɤ-kɯ-mbi me
trs: Nobody will give you another (daughter in marriage).' (2002 qaCpa, 57)

src: nɯ ɕɯŋgɯ tɕe, ɯ-kɯ-rga pɯ-dɤn.
trs: Before, there used to be many people who liked it.' (12-Zmbroko, 112)

src: kɯ-pe tú-wɣ-nɤma tɕe li tɯʑo tɯ-kɯ-pe tu
trs: If one does good things, one will also have good things.' (140518 mao he laoshu-zh, 124)

src: aʑo a-kɯ-ra nɯra a-tɤ-tɯ-ste qʰendɤre aʑo nɯnɯ, nɤki, ku-nɤtsi-a jɤɣ
trs: If you do the things I need, I will keep it secret.'  (2014-kWlAG, 247)

src: tɕaχpa ra ɣɯ nɯ-kɯ-mna nɯ wuma ʑo pjɤ-nɯrɤŋom.
trs: The chief of the bandits was very upset.' (140512 alibaba-zh, 195)

src: iɕqʰa qaʑo ɯ-kɯ-ntsɣe tʰɯ-kɯ-ɣe nɯ ɯ-pʰe
trs: (He told) the person who had come to sell the sheep.' (2003kandZislama, 212)

src: ɯ-kɯ-ndza ju-kɯ-ɣi nɯ pɣa ci ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: The one who comes to eat (the fruits) is a bird.' (2012 qachGa, 22)

src: ɯʑɤɣ nɯ ɕɯŋgɯ ɯ-nmaʁ pɯ-kɯ-ŋu tsʰɯraŋ nɯ pjɤ-mto
trs: She saw Tshering, who used to be her husband.' (qajdoskAt2002, 101)

src: nɯnɯ ɯ-nɯ-kɯ-ɕar ɯ-pɯ-kɯ-mto nɯ ɣɯ ɲɯ-tʂaŋ ma nɯnɯ, nɤkinɯ, ɯ-ɕɯ-kɯ-βɟi nɯ ɣɯ mɯ́j-tʂaŋ
trs: It is fair that she would (be given) to the one who looked for her and found her, not to the ones chasing her.' (140517 buaishuohua-zh, 123)

src: mɯ-ku-kɯ-tsʰi
trs: The one who drinks it.' (elicited)

src: tɕe nɯnɯ ɯ-taʁ jɯ\redp{}jɤ-kɯ-ɣe nɯ ku-ndɤm ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: (The spider) catches all of the (insects) that have come on (the web).' (26-mYaRmtsaR, 108)

src: nɯ ɯ-rkɯ jɤ-azɣɯt-nɯ tɕe, ʑara nɯ-tu-kɯ-ndza srɯnmɯ ci pjɤ-tu,
trs: There was a râkshasî who ate those who had arrived near her.' (2012 Kunbzang, 255)

src: tɕe ndzɤpri kɤ-ti nɯ tɕe tɯrme tu-kɯ-ndza ɲɯ-ŋgrɤl
trs: The brown bear, it eats people.' (21-pri, 94)

src: kʰa ɯ-ŋgɯ nɯtɕu tɕʰeme ʁnɯz kɯ-rɯɕmi pjɤ-tu.
trs: There were two girls speaking in the house.' (150909 xiaocui-zh, 157)

src: aʑo [ndʑi-kɯ-qur] cʰɯ-ɣi-a je
trs: Let me come to help you.' (tWJo 2005, 25)

src: ʑara kɯ [cʰa nɯ ku-kɯ-tsʰi] to-nɯɕpɯz-nɯ,
trs: They pretended to drink the alcohol (`imitated an alcohol drinker').'  (Norbzang 2012, 91)

src: aʑo a-ŋgra a-kɯcʰi ci tɤ-χti ra
trs: Give me a candy as a reward.' (140515 congming de wusui xiaohai-zh, 82)

src: tɕe nɯnɯ li tú-wɣ-ndza tɕe, kɯ-cʰi tu, mɤ-kɯ-cʰi tu.
trs: When one eats them, some are sweet, some are not.' (08-rasti, 55)

src: mɤ-ti-a ma kɯŋu mɤ-tɯ-nɤme
trs: I won't say it, because you will not do the right thing.' (2005 Kunbzang, 397)

src: nɯnɯ kɯ, nɯnɯtɕu kɯ\redp{}kɯ-rɤʑi nɯ to-ɣɤ-mna. to-ɣɤ-mna ɯ-qʰu tɕe tɕendɤre <quanxian> tɕe kɯ\redp{}kɤ-kɯ-nɤndza nɯ ɲɤ-ɣɤ-me
trs: He healed all those who were staying there (in the leper house). After he healed them, he had eradicated leprosy (removed all lepers) from our district.' (25-khArWm, 82)

src: tɤkɤzbɣaʁ nɯ tɤ-mŋɤm qʰe, tɕe nɯ ɯ-qʰu nɤ, ŋgɯsqɤ-rʑaʁ ʑo mɯ-tu-mna
trs: After the migraine starts, it does not recede until nine or ten days. (conversation taRrdo 2003, 9)

src: ɯnɯnɯ kɯɕɯŋgɯ tɕe kɯ-qur ju-kɯ-ɕe tɕe nɯnɯ, mɯ-nɯ-ɬoʁ mɤɕtʂa nɯ tu-kɯ-nɯna mɯ-pjɤ-jɤɣ ɲɯ-ŋu tɕe,  tɕe núndʐa kɯqurʑŋgri tu-sɤrmi-nɯ
trs: Long ago, when one would go helping, one was not supposed to rest until it comes out, and for this reason it was called `star of the helper'.' (29-mWBZi, 62)

imt: the.aforementioned \textsc{indef}.\textsc{poss}-sky \textsc{dem} every.day \textsc{emph} every.day \textsc{emph} \textsc{irr}-\textsc{pfv}-release \textsc{lnk} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.after \textsc{lnk} one one \textsc{ipfv}-release one one \textsc{ipfv}-be.sunny \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.like be:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{dem} \textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-release showery.rain \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.like \textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-release  \textsc{dem} \textsc{dem} \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.like \textsc{irr}-\textsc{pfv}-release \textsc{lnk} \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-after \textsc{lnk} \textsc{indef}.\textsc{poss}-sky \textsc{neg}-release:\textsc{fact} \textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{genr}-say be:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{dem} \textsc{indef}.\textsc{poss}-sky \textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-release \textsc{dem} type.of.rain \textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{genr}-say be:\textsc{fact}
src: iɕqʰa tɯ-mɯ nɯ sɲikuku ʑo, sɲikuku ʑo a-kɤ-lɤt tɕe tɕe, kɯ-maqʰu tɕe ci ci ku-lɤt, ci ci ɲɯ-jɯm kɯ-fse ŋu tɕe, ɯnɯnɯ ku-kɯ-lɤt, <zhenyu> kɯ-fse ku-kɯ-lɤt nɯ, nɯnɯ kɯ-fse a-kɤ-lɤt tɕe ɯ-qhu tɕe tɯ-mɯ mɤ-lɤt tu-kɯ-ti ŋu tɕe, nɯnɯ tɯ-mɯ ku-kɯ-lɤt nɯ kɯndzarmɯ tu-kɯ-ti ŋu
trs: When it rains (continuously) everyday, followed by sporadic rain (sometimes it rains, sometimes it is sunny), when there is a showery rain and after that no more rain, this type of (showery) rain is called \forme{kɯndzarmɯ}.' (definition, 2015-04-18)

src: ri nɯnɯ stu ɯ-kɤ-rga, ɯ-kɤ-nɤ-mɯm pjɤ-ɕti.
trs: But it was what he liked most, what he found most tasty.' (160703 poucet3, 74)

src: tɕe nɯ-mɤ-kɤ-cʰa nɯ kʰɯna χsɯm pɯ-tu qʰe, nɯra kɯ rcanɯ ɕlaʁ ʑo ku-ndo-nɯ ɲɯ-ɕti.
trs: The (rats) that they (the people) had been unable to (catch), there were three dogs, these (dogs) caught them at once.' (150831 BZW kAnArRaR, 48)

src: tɕe aʑo a-mɤ-kɤ-sɯz tɤjmɤɣ nɯ kɤ-ndza mɤ-naz-a
trs: I do not dare to eat the mushrooms that I do not know.' (23-mbrAZim, 113)

src: ɯ-pɕi tɕe ɯ-ɕɯ-kɤ-nɤma ci pjɤ-tu tɕe,
trs: (The mouse) had something to do outside.' (140518 mao he laoshu-zh, 88)

src: tɕe pɤjka wuma nɯnɯ tɕe, pjɯ-kɤ-nɯ-ji ŋu tɕe,
trs: The gourd proper is cultivated (it does not grow on its own).' (16-CWrNgo, 63)

src: tɕʰeme nɯ kɯ iɕqʰa, ɯ-jaʁ <meihua>, mɯntoʁ pɯ-kɤ-ɤsɯ-ndo nɯ pjɤ-ɣɤrɤt.
trs: The girl threw down the plum blossom, the flower that she was holding in her hand.' (150907 yingning-zh, 30)

src: [ɬamu kɯ qajɣi nɯ-kɤ-mbi] nɯ tu-ndze pjɤ-ŋu
trs: (As) he was eating the (pieces of) bread that Lhamo had given him.' (2002 qajdoskAt, 111)

src: [aʑo kɯ pɯ-kɤ-sɯ-rɤt] nɯnɯ pjɯ-ndɯn ɲɯ-ŋu nétɕi
trs: (The pen said: the poet is reading the poem) that has been written using me.' (150818 bi he moshuihu-zh, 143)

src: lɤ-fsoʁ ɯ-jɯja nɯ pjɯ-ru tɕe [ɯ-kɤ-nɯmbrɤpɯ] nɯ kʰu pɯ-ɕti ɲɯ-ŋu,
trs: As the day broke, looking down, he (progressively realized that) what he was riding was a tiger.' (2005 khu, 20)

src: a-ɬaʁ, tɕe nɤ-kɯ-mŋɤm tɕʰi ɲɯ-fse ma [alo qʰaqʰu nɤ-kɤ-ti] nɯra tɤ-stu-t-a
trs: Stepmother, how do you feel, I did the things you said (about creating a lake) up there behind the house.' (28-smAnmi, 361)

src: [nɯŋa ɯ-ndʐi tʰɯ-kɤ-rɤɣdɯt], tʰɯ-kɤ-tʂɯβ nɯ ɯ-ŋgɯ nɯtɕu ko-ɕe
trs: He went into the cow hide that had been skinned and sewed.'    (02-deluge2012, 32)

src: [kɯ-cʰi kɯ kʰa tɤ-kɤ-sɯ-βzu] ci pjɤ-mto-ndʑi
trs: They saw a house that was made from sweets.' (140507 tangguowu-zh, 78)

src: [lonba ɕom kɯ nɯ-kɤ-sɯ-βzu] kʰa pjɤ-ŋu
trs: It was a house made completely from iron.' (140505 liuhaohan zoubian tianxia-zh, 153)

src: tɕe [kʰru kɯ tʰɯ-kɤ-sɯ-lɤt] laʁdɯn kɯnɤ tu ma
trs: There are also tools that are made of cast iron.' (30-Com, 29)

src: nɯ ma ɯ-kɤ-mbi maŋe tɕe, ``a-me ta-mbi ra" to-ti tɕe,
trs: He had nothing else to give him, and said `I give you my daughter'.' (2011-04-smanmi, 171)

src: tɕendɤre [tɯmɯkɤrŋi kɯ pɯ-kɤ-sɯxɕɤt] ra ɲɤ-nɤxtʂɯn tɕe tɕe nɯɕimɯma ʑo pjɤ-nɯ-ɕe.
trs: (Pu'an) was thankful for the things that the god of heaven had taught him and went back (to earth) immediately.' (150827 taisui-zh, 135)

src: iɕqʰa, [kɤntɕʰɯ-xpa ʑo, nɤki, xɕiri nɯ-kɤ-sɯxɕɤt] nɯ pjɤ-sat,
trs: He killed the weasel that he had trained for several years.'  (140518 xuezhe he huangshulang-zh, 28)

src: nɤ-kɤ-tʰu ɯ-ɣɤʑu nɤ, tɤ-tʰe jɤɣ
trs: If you have and questions, you can ask them.' (conversation 14-11-08)

src: iɕqʰa <macha> kɤ-ti nɯ [iʑora stu ji-kɤ-rga] ŋu
trs: The (type of tea) called `macha' is what we like most.' (30-macha, 1)

src: nɤ-kɤ-rɤ-mbi nɯ tɕʰi pɯ-ŋu?
trs: What was it that you gave (to people)?' (elicited)

src: tɕe [<shuijing> kɯ tɤ-kɤ-sɯ-βzu] ɣɯ tɯ-xtsa nɯra jo-ɣɯt.
trs: (The bird) brought shoes made of crystal.' (140504 huiguniang-zh, 162)

src: [ndʑi-mɲaʁ mɯ-tɤ-kɤ-rɤt] nɯni tɕetu, znde ɯ-taʁ nɯtɕu nɯnɯ pjɤ-nɯ-tu-ndʑi.
trs: The two (dragons) whose eyes had not been drawn were still present on the wall.' (160718 hualongdianjing-zh, 62)

src: qaɕpa nɯnɯ, iɕqʰa nɯ, rɟɤlpu ci ɣɯ ɯ-tɕɯ nɯnɯ, nɤkinɯ, tɯ-sŋaʁ tɤ-kɤ-lɤt tɕe qaɕpa nɯ-kɤ-sɤβzu pjɤ-ŋu.
trs: This frog was the son of a king who had been enchanted and transformed into a frog.' (140429 qingwa wangzi-zh,  180-181)

src: a-tɕɯ nɯ ɯ-taʁ tɯ-sŋaʁ to-lɤt tɕe nɯ mbalɤ-pɯ ci ɲɤ-sɤβzu.
trs: She cast a spell on my son and turned him into a calf.' (140512 fushang he yaomo-zh, 105)

src: [tɕi-rna mɤ-kɤ-mtsʰɤm], [tɕi-mɲaʁ mɤ-kɤ-mto] a-jɤ-ɕe-ndʑi ra
trs: May they go away (to a place) where our ears cannot hear them, where our eyes cannot see them.' (2003-kWBRa, 23)

src: <xingqi> raŋri ʑo tɕe nɯnɯ sɤβʑɯ ɣɯ ɯ-kʰa nɯtɕu kɤ-nɤkʰu ju-ɣi pjɤ-ŋu
trs: He would come to the mouse's house as a guest.' (150818 muzhi guniang-zh, 299).

src: a-kɤ-nɤkʰu jɤ-ɣe
trs: He came to my house as a guest (following my invitation).' (elicited)

src: ndʑi-kɤ-ndza kɤ-tsʰi mɤ-mbrɤt, ndʑi-kɯ-ndzɤtsʰi a-pɯ-me smɯlɤm
trs: May you never lack food or drink, may there nobody (coming to) eat you.' (2003kAndZWslama, 218)

src: a-kɤpa maŋe
trs: I have no way to do it.' (many attestations)

src: nɤ-kɤ-pa tɯ\redp{}tu nɤ,  tɤ-pe ma mtsʰoʁlaŋ tɤ-ɣe
trs: If you have some way (to protect us), use it, because the water monster has come.' (Norbzang 2012, 27-28)

src: nɯnɯ ɯ-taʁ nɯtɕu nɤ-kɤ-stu ɯ-ɣɤʑu tɕe a-tɤ-tɯ-ste ma tɕe
trs: If you have a way to deal with him, use it.'   (25-kAmYW-XpAltCin, 37)

src: ɯ-sɤ-ɣi
trs: The place/moment from where/when he/it comes.' (elicited)

src: tɤjmɤɣ ɯ-sɤ-tu ɯ-sɤ-me ɣɤʑu.
trs: There are places where there are mushrooms, and other places where there aren't.' (20-grWBgrWB, 46)

src: tɕeri nɯnɯ sɤtɕʰa nɯ li iɕqʰa qapribɯxsi ɯ-sɤz-rɤʑi pjɤ-ɕti.
trs: But that place was the abode of a python.' (140511 xinbada-zh, 92)

src: tɕe <xinbaba> rcanɯ, maka nɯtɕu ɯ-z-rɤʑi ɯ-tɯ-sɤɣ-mu pjɤ-sɤre ʑo tɕe,
trs: Sinbad, the place where he stayed was extremely terrifying.' (140511 xinbada-zh, 99)

src: qʰe tú-wɣ-cɯ mɤ-kɯ-kʰɯ, sɤ-nɯ-ɬoʁ ri kɯ-me ta-βzu.
trs: (He put tape on the drawers so that) they could not be opened, and there was no way to come out of it (to prevent the rats inside from escaping).' (150831 BZW kAnArRaR)

src: ɯ-sɤɣ-nɯ-ɬoʁ ɣɯ ɯ-kɯ-spoʁ pjɤ-ŋu.
trs: It was the hole from which it (the animal) came out (of the cave).  (140511 xinbada-zh, 83)

imtwordshtml: 3pl.poss-obl:pcp-auto-acaus:separate
src: nɯ-sɤz-nɯ-ɴɢɤt ɣɯ iɕqʰa, tʂɤsɤɴɢɤt nɯtɕu jɤ-azɣɯt-nɯ tɕe,
trs: They arrived at the crossroads where they had parted ways.' (140508 benling gaoqiang de si xiongdi, 109)

src: qajsta nɯnɯ kɯɕɯŋgɯ qaj ɯ-sɤ-ji pjɤ-pe tɕe tɕe núndʐa qajsta tu-ti-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: Qaysta, in former time it was a wheat field which was good, and for this reason, it is called `Qaysta' `the place of the wheat'.' (140522 kAmYW tWji2, 104)

src: tɕe tɯmgri sɤz-rɤ-ji nɯ koŋla ɲɤ-ɣɤ-me-nɯ ma kʰa ʁɟa ʑo to-βzu-nɯ.
trs: They removed all the fields in Temgri, and built houses there (instead).' (140522 kAmYW tWji2, 18)

src: a-kɤ-ndza ri ɣɤʑu, a-sɤz-rɤʑi ri ɣɤʑu qʰe
trs: (There), I have food to eat and a place to stay.' (150831 renshen wawa, 24)

src: nɯstʰamtɕɤt ɣɯ nɯ-sɤ-tʂɯβ nɯ tɯ-ŋgru tu-sɯ-βzu-nɯ.
trs: People use sinew to sew that many (types of clothes and shoes).' (150906 tWNgru, 17)

src: kɯɕte nɯtɕu nɤ-sɤ-ta me ɯ́-ŋu
trs: Isn't there any other place where you put (the food)?' (meimei de gushi, 72)

src: tɕe iʑora ɣɯ nɯ-sɤ-ntɕʰoz a-pɯ-tu tɕe ɲɯ-tʂɯn
trs: We are glad that (some) of us have an opportunity to be useful to them.' (conversation, 140510)

imt: \textsc{lnk} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{1pl}.\textsc{poss}-bowl \textsc{obl}:\textsc{pcp}-put.in \textsc{gen} \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-inside \textsc{dem} drawer \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-inside \textsc{pst}.\textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{auto}-be \textsc{dem} other \textsc{dem}:\textsc{pl} \textsc{pst}.\textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{auto}-be  also at.all thing \textsc{obj}:\textsc{pcp}-put.in whether \textsc{obj}:\textsc{pcp}-eat \textsc{obj}:\textsc{pcp}-put.in whether \textsc{dem} \textsc{ipfv}-eat[III] \textsc{lnk}  \textsc{ipfv}-eat[III]
src: tɕe tɕe ji-kʰɯtsa sɤ-rku ɣɯ ɯ-ŋgɯ nɯ, <chouchou> ɯ-ŋgɯ pɯ-nnɯ-ŋu, nɯ kɯmaʁ nɯra pɯ-nnɯ-ŋu kɯnɤ maka, laχtɕʰa kɤ-rku me, kɤ-ndza kɤ-rku me, nɯra tu-ndze nɤ tu-ndze,
trs: Whether it was in the cupboard where we put (our) bowls, in the drawers or elsewhere, whether it was things put in there or food, (the mice) ate/gnawed it again and again.' (150831 BZW kAnArRaR, 5)

src: nɯ sɤznɤ a-mbrɤz sɤ-rku a-pɯ-ŋu ɲɯ-ra
trs: Why don't I use (this basin) as a rice container?' (150831 jubaopen-zh, 27)

src: nɯ ɕɯŋgɯ ɯ-sɤ-sqa pɯ-kɯ-ŋu ɯ-ŋgɯ (tu-rku-nɯ)
trs: (They put it) in the (pan) that had been used before to cook (the barley grains).' (31-cha, 64)

src: qaʑmbri nɯ, nɤkinɯ, ɯ-sɤ-pe ra me, ɯ-mɤ-sɤ-pe ra me,
trs: The vine is neither an advantage nor a harm (to the plants on which it grows).' (06-qaZmbri, 17)

src: ndʑi-sɤx-ɕe nɯtɕu jo-zɣɯt tɕe
trs: (The ox) arrived at the place towards which the two of them were going.' (150826 shier shengxiao-zh, 86)

src: [prɤɕta tʂu ku-sɤx-ɕe] nɯre ri tɯ-ji ci tu tɕe, nɯ cɤŋgɤɣ rmi.
trs: On the road (one has to go through to reach) Prashta there is a field, it is called Kyangag.' (140522 kAmYW tWji, 116-117)

src: pɤjka wuma ʑo a-pɯ-pe, tɕe ɯ-sɤx-ɕe nɯra a-pɯ-dɤn ɯ-sɤz-nɤɕɯɕe a-pɯ-dɤn tɕe, pɤjka tɯ-pʰɯ ɯ-taʁ nɯtɕu kɯβdɤsqi jamar, ɯ-mat ku-tsʰoʁ ɲɯ-cʰa
trs: When the pumpkin (grows) well, and when there are a lot of (places on) which it can spread, one plant can have about fourty pumpkin.' (16-CWrNgo, 96)

src: iʑora nɯ ji-sɤ-ɣi nɯtɕu pjɤ-ŋu tɕe.
trs: The place from where we come was there.' (2010-06, 3)

src: tɕe saŋdi nɯ tɕe, nɯnɯ si ɯ-sɤ-ta ɯ-rkoz ʑo pjɤ-ŋu.
trs: The lower side of the hearth was specifically where (people) put firewood.' (2011-11, 33)

src: tɕʰemɤpɯ nɯra, [nɯ-ŋga sɤ-ta] nɯtɕu ko-ɕe, [nɯ-ŋga na-nɯ-ta-nɯ] nɯtɕu ko-ɕe matɕi,
trs: He went to the place where the girls put their clothes, where they had put their clothes.' (150828 niulang-zh, 59)

src: pjɤ-nɯkɯlu-nɯ ma sɤ-nɯ-ɕe ɣɯ ɯ-tʂu nɯ mɯ-ɲɤ-nɯ-mto-nɯ.
trs: They were lost, and could not find the way back home.' (160630 poucet1, 55)

imtwordshtml: ipfv:west-obl:pcp-auto-acaus:separate
src: [[rpɤŋgɯ tʂu lu-sɤx-ɕe] cʰo [prɤscʰɯ tʂu lu-sɤ-ɣi] ɲɯ-sɤ-nɯ-ɴɢɤt] nɯtɕu,
trs: At the place where the road towards Rpangu and the road towards Praskhyu separate.' (140522 kAmYW tWji2, 125)

src: ɯ-slamaχti nɯ ɣɯ, [ɯ-z-rɤ-rɤt] ci to-nɯ-ndo tɕe jo-nɯ-tsɯm ɲɯ-ŋu tɕe,
trs: He took away the pen of a classmate.' (2014-tou dongxi de xiaohai-zh, 5)

src: nɯnɯ [tɯtʰɯ sɤ-χtɕi], [tɯ-ŋga sɤ-pɕiz] nɯra tu-sɯ-βzu-nɯ pɯ-ŋgrɤl.
trs: People used to employ (Usnea) as tools to wash pans or wipe clothes.' (20-sWrna, 151)

src: ɯnɯnɯ kɯ [ɯ-sɤ-ɕmi] tu-sɯ-βzu-nɯ pɯ-ŋgrɤl
trs: People used to employ it (a boat oar) to mix it (the alcohol).' (31-cha, 45)

src: qajdo [ɯ-rʑaβ ɯ-ɕki ɯ-sɤz-nɯrmɤʑu] nɯ mɲɤm kɤ-pʰaʁ pjɤ-ŋu
trs: What he was showing off with in front of his wife was chopping the wood of the \forme{mɲɤm} tree (which is easy to cut).' (11-mYAm, 24)

src: [ɯ-sɤ-fɕɤt] pjɤ-me qʰe tɕe tɤ-pɤtso ɯ-ɕki nɯ tɕu nɯra tɕʰi pɯ-kɯ-fse nɯra pjɤ-fɕɤt.
trs: She had no one (else) to tell it to, so she told the boy everything that had happened.' (140515 congming de wusui xiaohai-zh, 77)

src: tɕe ɯʑo [ɯ-sɤ-ɤmɯmi] nɯ dɤn ma ca kɯ-fse qaʑo kɯ-fse, tsʰɤt kɯ-fse,  ɯʑo cʰo kɯ-naχtɕɯɣ sɯjno, xɕaj ma mɤ-kɯ-ndza nɯ ra cʰo nɯ amɯmi-nɯ tɕe,
trs: The (animals) that are in good terms with the rabbit are many, it is in good terms with those that only eat grass, like musk deer, sheep or goats.' (04 qala1, 33-4)

src: tɕe nɯnɯ ʑaka [ɯ-sɤ-ji] ɲɯ-ŋu tɕe
trs: These are the (periods) when people plant each of these (crops).' (15 tChWma, 19)

imt: new.year three \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-time \textsc{loc} whole.year \textsc{gen} \textsc{filler} date \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-\textsc{obl}:\textsc{pcp}-be.good be:\textsc{fact} \textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{genr}-say be:\textsc{fact}
src: lɤsɤr χsɯm ɯ-raŋ tɕe, tɯxpalɤskɤr ɣɯ, nɤkinɯ, [skɤrma ɯ-sɤ-sna] ŋu tu-kɯ-ti ŋu.
trs: We say that the third day of the year is the (most) auspicious day in the whole year.' (2010-10, 143)

src: tɕe [sɤz-nɯŋgra] ɣɤʑu ri, li sɤɣʑɯr
trs: Although it (provides) an opportunity to earn wages, it is also dangerous.' (conversation 140510)

src: iʑora tɕe kʰa ɯ-ŋgɯ kɤ-kɤ-ja ʑo ɲɯ-fse-j ku-rɤʑit-i ma [ji-sɤx-ɕe] maŋe
trs: We were like locked in the house, with nowhere to go.' (140501 tshering skyid, 116)

src: tɯ-ji ɯ-rkɯ ra tɤ-ɣur pjɯ-ta-nɯ tɕe, fsapaʁ ɯ-mɤ-sɤx-ɕe tu-βzu-nɯ ŋgrɤl
trs: They put a fence around the fields, so as to prevent domestic animals to go there.' (140427 qamtsWrmdzu, 14)

src: tɕʰeme kɯ-ŋɤn nɯ kɯ iɕqʰa nɯ, rgargɯn nɯnɯ ɯ-sɤ-ʁjɯ\redp{}ʁjit to-βzu tɕe,
trs: The evil woman reminded the old man.' (140515 jiesu de laoren-zh, 128)

src: ɯ-ŋgɯ lɤ-ɣi jɤɣ ma sɤcɯ mɤ-a-lɤt
trs: Come in, the door is not locked.' (140428 xiaohongmao-zh, 78)

src: kɯ-xtɕɯ\redp{}xtɕi ci ʑo antɤm, tɕe nɯ kɯ-lɤɣ ra nɯtɕu ku-rɤʑi-nɯ pjɤ-ŋgrɤl
trs: (The place called \forme{kɯlɤɣsɤmdzɯ}) is a bit flat, and shepherd used to stay there.' (140522 Kamnyu zgo, 281)

src: tɤ-pɤtso ɯ-sɤz-bɯwa
trs: Something used to carry children on the back' (definition given for the noun \forme{sɤɕtɕɯɣ})

src: ki ɯ-ʁɤri kɯ-fse nɯ ɯ-sta ʑo pɯ-nɯ-fse nɤ
trs: She had become again like she was before.' (2003 Kunbzang, 484)

src: a-re ma-tɯ-tɕɤt
trs: Don't laugh at me!' (elicited)

src: ɯ-pi ʁnɯz ni kɯnɤ tsʰɯrɟɯn ʑo, nɤkinɯ, pjɯ́-wɣ-ɣɤ-kʰe tɕe ndʑi-tɤresɤtɕɯtɕɤt ra tu-βzu-ndʑi pjɤ-ŋu.
trs: His two elder brothers often called him a stupid person and mocked him.' (140430 jin e, 11)

src: nɤ-tɤresɤtɕɯtɕɤt ma-tɤ-kɯ-sɯ-βzu-a
trs: Don't mock me!' (elicited)

src: aʑo kɤ-ndza mɯ-pɯ-rɲo-t-a
trs: I never ate that.' (many attestations)

src: aj kɤ-ɕe mɯ-pɯ-rɲo-t-a
trs: I never went there.' (150820 ZNGWloR, 4)

src: a-mgɯr ɲɯ-mŋɤm tɕe ɕɯ-kɤ-χtɯ mɯ́j-cʰa-a
trs: My back hurts and I cannot go to  buy (apples).' (conversation, 30-04-2018)

src: rɟɤlpu fka ɕti tɕe, mɤ-kɤ-ɕe mɤ-kʰɯ
trs: This is the king's order, (I) have no choice but to go.' (Norbzang 2005, 12)

src: tɤ-se mɯ-pjɯ-kɤ-ɬoʁ ftɕaka tu-βze-a tu-mdzoz-a pɯ-ŋu ma,
trs: I avoided by all means to let the blood come out.' (24-pGArtsAG, 57)

src: ɯ-mŋu nɯ pa pjɯ́-wɣ-ɕtʰɯz tɕe nɯ [ɯ-kɤlɤjme pjɯ-kɤ-ɕtʰɯz] tu-kɯ-ti ŋu.
trs: One turns the mouth (of the container) downwards, it is called `to turn upside down'.' (30-macha, 68)

src: ɯ-kɤχcɤl ɯ-ʁrɯ nɯ a-nɯ-pʰɯt tɕe kɤ-nɯ-ɕe cʰa ɲɯ-ɕti
trs: If one takes out the horn on his head, he will be able to go back (to heavens).' (divination 2005, 91)

src: [a-rŋɯl kɤ-tu] pɯ-rɲo-t-a
trs: I used to have money'. (elicited)

src: nɯ ɯ-mdoʁ nɯ aj [kɤ-ti] mɯ́j-spe-a
trs: I don't know how to say (describe) its colour.' (06-qaZmbri, 05)

src: tɕe ndʑi-ju-kɤ-ɕe pjɤ-me
trs: They could not go.' (150908 menglang-zh, 46)

src: tɯ-rʑaʁ nɯ ɯ-pjɯ-kɤ-nɯʑɯβ pjɤ-me matɕi,
trs: He could not sleep the whole night, because...' (150831 BZW kAnArRaR, 12)

src: a-pjɯ-kɤ-nɯʑɯβ na-ɣɤ-me
trs: He made me unable to sleep.' (elicited)

src: kɤ-ŋke lɤ-ɣe-a
trs: I came on foot.' (17-lhazgron, 12)

src: nɤʑo [laχtɕʰa kɤ-fkur] tu-tɯ-ŋke ɲɯ-ŋu tɕe
trs: You are walking carrying things on your back.' (150909 hua pi-zh, 12)

src: [tɕʰi kɤ-cʰa] to-k-ɤndzɯt-ci ri, maka ʑo kɯ-pʰɤn pjɤ-me
trs: (The dog) barked as much as it could, but it was all for nothing.'  (140426 gou he qingwa-zh, 21)

src: <kaihui> kɯ-fse tɤ-ra tɕe, kɤ-ŋke ʁɟa ʑo ju-kɯ-ɕe pɯ-ra.
trs: When one had to (take part in) a meeting for instance, one had to go on foot.' (12-BzaNsa, 22)

src: maka to-nɯmbrɤpɯ-nɯ tɕe li kɤ-rɟɯɣ kɯ ʑo jo-ɕe-nɯ.
trs: They mounted their horses and galloped away.' (140512 alibaba-zh, 42)

src: maka mɤ-kɤ-rɯsɯso kɯ ʑo `jɤɣ' to-ti, to-nɤla.
trs: She said `yes', she agreed without thinking at all.' (140429 qingwa wangzi-zh, 67)

imtwordshtml: ipfv:east-inv-caus-go.back-1sg-du
src: [a-mu a-wi ni mɤ-kɤ-ɤtɯɣ] kú-wɣ-sɯ-jɣat-a-ndʑi.
trs: (My uncles) forced me to go back (to school) without having met my mother and my grandmother (even though I had not met...).' (2010-Dpalcan-09, 54)

src: [ʑara kɯ-tu] ʑo to-sɤrɯru tɕe,
trs: He compared (his testimony with theirs) in their presence.' (150909 xifangping-zh, 155)

src: tɕe nɤj a-pi [nɤʑo kɯ-me] aʑo kɤ-rɤʑi mɤ-cʰa-a
trs: Brother, without you I cannot stay (here).' (2011-05-nyima, 53)

src: tɕendɤre mɤkɯftsʰi ʑo, nɤki ɯ-me ɣɯ ɯ-mi nɯ iɕqʰa tɯ-xtsa ɯ-ŋgɯ nɯtɕu cʰɤ-sɯ-rku
trs: She forced her daughter to put her foot into that shoe.' (140504 huiguniang-zh, 228)

src: ɯ-tɕɯ kɯβde nɯra wuma ʑo ŋɤtɕɯkɤti pjɤ-kʰɯ-nɯ
trs: His four sons were very obedient.' (140508 benling gaoqiang de si xiongdi-zh, 15)

src: nɤʑo kɯ-fse a-ŋkʰor nɯ ɯ-mto mɯ-pɯ-rɲo-t-a
trs: I never saw anyone like you among my subjects.' (28-smAnmi,  393)

src: kɤtsa ni ndʑi-pa ɲɯ-ʁzɤβ rca
trs: The two of them do things very carefully.' (14-05-10)

src: tɕe nɯnɯ tɯ-ŋga nɯ ɯ-tʂɯβ tʰɯ-jɤɣ
trs: When one has finished sewing the clothes, ...' (30-tWNga, 29)

src: lu-ji-nɯ qʰe ɯ-nɤpɯpa tu-ɣɤ-βdi-nɯ, ɯ-ɣli ra ku-sɤpe-nɯ qʰe, cʰɯ-do ɲɯ-cʰa.
trs: (Now people) plant (pumpkin also in higher areas), (if) they take good care of it and put enough fertilizers, it can become fibrous (so that it can be sowed for the next year).' (140522 kAmYW tWji, 47)

src: ndʑi-mi ɯ-tsʰoʁ ɯ-tsʰɯɣa nɯra wuma ʑo naχtɕɯɣ-ndʑi.
trs: The way their feet (of fleas and crickets) touch the ground is very similar.' (26-mYaRmtsaR, 17)

src: ndza mɤ-ndza me-a
trs: Whether (you ) eat me or not, it amounts to the same.' (sentence obtained as the correction of a sentence I produced to translate a story in Japhug)

src: tɕe ɯ-qiɯ ɲɯ-mtsʰam-a, ɯ-qiɯ mɯ́j-mtsʰam-a qʰe, ɕe mɤ-ɕe maŋe
trs: I can hear half of it, can't hear the other half, whether or not (I) go it amounts to the same.' (conversation 140510)

src: tɯ-ŋke ta-ʑa tɕe
trs: When it starts moving...' (26-NalitCaRmbWm, 79)

src: si nɯ daltsɯtsa nɯ tɯ-ɤrŋi ɲo-ʑa tɕe
trs: The tree slowly started to become green.' (divination 2003, 110)

src: tɯ-mɯ kɯ-wxtɯ\redp{}wxti ʑo tɯ-lɤt pjɤ-ʑa
trs: A big rain started.' (150819 haidenver-zh, 104)

src: qaɟy ɯ-me nɯnɯ, tɕendɤre kʰro mɤ-tɯ-rga to-ʑa
trs: He started not liking the mermaid that much (anymore).' (150819 haidenver-zh, 154)

src: mtsʰu nɯ cʰɯmcʰɯm ʑo, tɕe, tɯ-skɤm pjɤ-sɤʑa
trs: The (water of the) lake started to retreat slowly.' (nyima wodzer 2003, 105)

src: mbarkʰom tɯ-ɣi pɯ-rɲo-t-a
trs: I came to Mbarkham before.' (elicited)

src: tɯ-rɤ-rɤt pa-ʑa
trs: He started writing.' (elicited)

src: tɤscoz ɯ-rɤt pa-ʑa
trs: He started writing the/a letter.' (elicited)

src: japa tɕe pʰaʁrgot ɯ-tɯ-nɤru ɲɯ-saχaʁ ʑo tɕe
trs: Last year, a boar was causing a lot of damages to the crops.' (150829 phaRrgot, 1)

src: tɯ-tɯ-ɤmdzɯ kɯ-βdi mɤ-kɯ-βdi kɯnɤ ʑo cʰɯ-sɤfɕɤra-nɯ pɯ-ɕti.
trs: People would discuss whether one sat well or not.' (31-khAjmu, 28)

src: maka ɯ-tɯ-nɤ-mpɕɤr kɯ pjɤ-nɤscɤr ʑo.
trs: He found her so beautiful that he was startled.' (140429 jiedi-zh, 181)

imtwordshtml: 3sg.poss-neg-nmlz:deg-facil-walk
src: maka ɯ-mɤ-tɯ-nɯɣɯ-ŋke pjɤ-saχaʁ ʑo
trs: It was extremely inconvenient to walk (on the soft earth).' (014-kWlAG, 148)

src: maka nɯ raz rcanɯ, ɯ-tɯ-pe ɲɯ-saχaʁ ʑo, ɯ-taʁ ɯ-tɯ-βdi, ɯ-tɯ-mpɕɤr ɲɯ-saχaʁ
trs: This piece of cloth is very nice, it is extremely well woven, it is extremely beautiful.' (140521 huangdi de xinzhuang-zh, 84-85)

src: a-wi a-taʁ ɯ-tɯ-ɤɣɯtʂɯn ɯ-grɤl me
trs: My grandmother was extremely kind to me (so that I have to repay her).' (2005 Kunbzang, 407)

src: lɤ-ɣi-nɯ wo tɤ-rɯndzɤtshi-nɯ ma, nɯ-tɯ-mtsɯr-ɕpaʁ nɯ, nɯ-tɯ-ɲat nɯ
trs: Come in and have a meal, you (must be) so hungry, thirsty and tired!' (160701 poucet2, 40)

src: ɯ-taʁ ɯ-tɯ-βdi, ɯ-tɯ-mpɕɤr!
trs: It is woven so well, it is so beautiful!' (140521 huangdi de xinzhuang-zh, 181)

src: nɯnɯ si nɯ ɯ-tɯ-jpum pjɤ-saχaʁ ʑo tɕe,
trs: That tree was extremely thick.' (150902 luban-zh, 101)

src: nɤ-tɯ-sɤre nɯ mɤ-ra
trs: What you (did/said) is outrageous.' (several examples)

imtwordshtml: 3sg.poss-nmlz:deg-apass:hum-bully
src: nɤ-tɯ-sɤ-nɤkʰe nɯ mɤ-ra
trs: You cannot treat people so badly.'  (2005tWJo, 47)

src: paʁ nɯ ɯ-βri, nɤki, ɯ-rme kɯ-me ʑo ɯ-tsʰɯɣa ɲɯ-fse ma ɯ-tɯ-tsʰu cʰondɤre ɯ-tɯ-rʁom ɯ-tsʰɯɣa nɯ ʑo ɲɯ-fse
trs: (The body of the elephant) resembles that of the pig in that it has no hair, in that it is fat and (its skin) is rough.' (19-RloNbutChi, 46-47)

src: tɕe <er> ɯ-tɯ-rɤt tsa ɲɯ-fse ri, nɯ stʰɯci mɯ-ɲɯ-ŋgɤɣ
trs: (The constellation) looks a little bit like the way `two' is written, but not as curved.' (29-LAntshAm, 55)

src: tɤ-rga kɯ ʑo tʰɯ-ari ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: She went there happily.' (2005 Kunbzang, 258)

src: a-ʁi, tɤ-ɣɲat cʰo tɤ-mtsɯr tɤ-ɕpaʁ kɯ mɯ́j-sɤ-cʰa tɕe, nɯna-j je
trs: Brother, we are so tired, hungry and thirsty that we can (go any further), let us rest!' (qachGa2012, 141)

src: maka ɯ-tɯ-mtsɯr kɯ kɤ-ŋke mɯ-ɲɤ-cʰa
trs: It was so hungry that it could not walk anymore.'  (140515 huli he yelv-zh, 41)

src: a-tɤ-mtsɯr nɯra ci a-nɯ-sɯɣ-ʑi ɲɯ-ra
trs: Let's (catch the mouse) to ease my hunger.' (140518 mao he laoshu-zh, 19)

src: nɯnɯ ɕoʁɕoʁ ɯ-taʁ pɯ-kɤ-rɤt qajɣi nɯ kɯ tɯ-tɤ-mtsɯr ɲɯ-ɣɤ-pʰɤn mɤ-cʰa
trs: Bread drawn on a piece of paper cannot ease one's hunger.' (160718 huabingchongji-zh, 35)

src: ʑɤni tɯ-tɯ-ɕe ja-βzu-ndʑi
trs: They went at the same time.' (elicited)

src: ɲɯ-nɯtɯfɕal-a
trs: I have diarrhea.' (elicited)

src: nɤrŋi nɯra, nɯ-tɯ-fɕɤl ci ɲɯ-βze ŋgrɤl tɕe
trs: Infants, they often suffer from diarrhea.' (17-xCAj, 112)

src: ɯ-tɕʰɯ to-lɤt
trs: He stabbed him.' (elicited)

src: to-nɯtɯtɕʰɯ tɕe pjɤ-sat
trs: She stabbed him and killed him.' (140512 alibaba, 300)

src: tɯpu ku-ta-nɯ tɕe, tɤ-pɤtso ɣɯ ɯ-laz ci ku-ta-nɯ,
trs: (To treat this disease), they apply moxibustion, they apply one on the forehead of the child.' (25-kACAl, 71)

src: tɯpɣaʁ lo-tɕɤt-ndʑi
trs: They cleared fields.' (07-deluge, 113)

src: sɤndzɯn <laoshi> ɯ-ɕki ri kɤ-ari-a tɕe, tɯ-rʑaʁ ɕ-pɯ-nɯ-rma-a
trs: I went to Sandzin's (house), and stayed there for one night.' (conversation 160811)

src: kʰa ra cʰɤ-fkaβ-ndʑi qʰe tɯrma ko-ndo-ndʑi
trs: They built a house and established a family.' (02-deluge 2012, 131)

src: tɯrma tɯ-βlɯ cʰɤ-nɯ-sɤɲcɣɤɲcɣɤt-nɯ kɤ-ti ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: They lead a prosperous life = they live happily ever after' (many examples)

src: ɯ-rqo nɯtɕu tɯqartsɯ tʰa-lɤt ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: He kicked her throat.' (Norbzang 2012, 292)

src: nɤ-ɕqʰe ɯβrɤ-ɣɤʑu?
trs: You don't have cough, have you?' (conversation, 2013-11-12)

src: ɯ-ti tɕi mɯ-pjɤ-naχtɕɯɣ, ɯ-tɯ-sɯ-ɤʑirja kɯnɤ mɯ-pjɤ-naχtɕɯɣ ma,
trs: The words for (father and mother) were different (between common and honorific register), and the respective orders (in which `mother' and `father' appear) were also different.'  (160706 apa ama, 7-8)

src: ɯ-re ci ɕmɯɣ ɲɤ-ɕlɯɣ
trs: She suddenly let a laugh escape.' (2002 qaCpa, 100)

src: ɯʑo nɯ  tatpa ta-ta ma qʰaru mucin ʑo mɯ-pa-lɤt nɤ tɤ-ari ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: He had faith, did not look back (downwards) at all and (succeeded in) going up to (the abode of the gods). (Norbzang, 129)

src: cʰɤtsʰi ko-ɣɤ-tɕʰom tɕe
trs: He had drunk too much alcohol.' (150829 jidian-zh, 16)

src: ɯ-βɣo nɯ pɯ-ari nɤ, ʁzɤn-rpu ʁɟa ʑo ɕ-ta-lɤt ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: (As he$_i$ fell down the throat of the giant snake$_j$) his lama$_k$ went down (to the place where the snake was) and hit it$_j$ repeatedly with his$_k$  monastic robe (to force it$_j$ to spit him$_i$ out).' (2003 kandZislama, 69)

src: ʑara kɯ [cʰa nɯ kʰramba-tsʰi] ka-βzu-nɯ
trs: They pretended to drink alcohol.' (Norbzang 2005, 100)

src: kɯzɣɤ-ɕar ʑo ɲɤ-βzu-nɯ
trs: They searched for it for a long time.' (elicited)

src: tɕe tó-wɣ-z-rɤŋgat tɕe, tɕendɤre nɯnɯ kɯ, iɕqʰa nɯ,  tɯ-ci tɯ-tɤ-ste to-rku. tɕe `kɯki nɤ-rkuz ŋu' to-ti.
trs: He prepared his departure, and gave him a bladder full of water to take with him, and said `this is your departing present'.' (28-smAnmi.txt, 264-265)

src: a-me kɯ a-rkuz rŋɯl ta-rku
trs: My daughter gave me some money (as present for my departure) (elicited)

src: tɕe aʑo nɯtɕu kɤ-ɕe a-ʁjiz mɯ́j-ɣi tɕe
trs: I don't want to go there.' (150909 hua pi-zh, 22)

src: pjɯ-ɲɟo ɕɯŋgɯ tɕe ɯ-mɲoz tú-wɣ-βzu ra
trs: One has to take preparations before it gets damaged.' (elicited)

src: ɯ-rmi ɯ-rkoz me.
trs: There is no specific name (for this type of kinship relationship).' (140425 kWmdza06, 149)

src: [sɤ-rgɯ\redp{}rga] kɯ jo-nɯ-ɕe
trs: He went back home happy.' (140516 yiguan ganlan-zh, 141)

src: tɕe [sɤz-nɯɣ-mɯ\redp{}ɣmu] ʑo ku-χse ɲɯ-ra.
trs: It$_i$ has to feed it$_i$  while being afraid of it.$_i$ '  (24-ZmbrWpGa, 110)

src: tɕendɤre tɤ-pi ni kɯ li [ndʑi-sɯm mɤ-sɤ-ɕɯ\redp{}ɕe] ʑo ɲɤ-ta-ndʑi
trs: The two elder brothers reluctantly left (the ducks) alone.' (140510 fengwang-zh, 40)

src: tɤɕime nɯnɯ kɯ [ɯ-qom sɤ-ɬɯ\redp{}ɬoʁ] kɯ nɯra tʰɯtʰɤci pɯ-kɯ-fse ra lonba ʑo pjɤ-fɕɤt ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: The young lady told everything that had happened while shedding tears.' (140428 mu e guniang-zh, 208)

src: [ɯ-rte sɤz-nɯ-tɯ\redp{}ta] jɤ-ari

src: [tɤ-pɤtso nɯ sɤ-ɤmdzɯ\redp{}mdzɯ] ku-z-rɤʑi-nɯ
trs: They (used to) put the children in sitting position (after having covered them in cloth).' (140426 tApAtso kAnWBdaR 2)

src: ɯ-mbrɯ sɤ-ŋgɯ\redp{}ŋgɯ kɯ ʑo jo-nɯ-ɕe.
trs: He went back home angry.' (150826 baoliandeng-zh, 95)

src: sɤ-rŋgɯ\redp{}rŋgɯ kɯnɤ tɯ-kɤrnoʁ ɲɯ-mtɕɯr tɕe,
trs: Even lying down, one feels dizzy (one's head is turning).' (29-tAmtshAzkAkWndo, 57)

src: sɤ-ŋkɯ\redp{}ŋke ʑo ɲɯ-ɤsɯ-ndza
trs: He is eating it while walking.' (elicited)

src: ɯʑo kɯ masɤrɯrju kʰɤndɯn nɯ ɲɤ-ndɯn
trs: He recited the mantra in secret.' (2012 Norbzang, 199)

src: nɤki tɤ-rɟit nɯ mɤsɤmdɤla ʑo to-ŋke

src: stɤrɟɯɣ nɤ stɤrɟɯɣ ʑo jo-nɯ-pʰɣo

src: tɕe nɯnɯ a-ɲɯ-sɤ-stɯ\redp{}stu nɯra tu-nɤme pjɤ-ŋu

trs: The two hardworking ones then became rather rich.' \citep[193--194]{lin09phd}
